item.title: Le Wand & Le Wand Petite
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: We were so excited when we got given the chance to try our hand at another up-and-coming wand and then… well, we rewrote this comic three times, and still don’t feel all the way pleased with it. We don’t like doing comparisons and try to focus on toys’ unique properties, its ability to please somebody […]
item.content:encoded:
Le Wand & Le Wand Petite

by Matthew Nolan on 11/26/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics »
  • Vibrators

We were so excited when we got given the chance to try our hand at another up-and-coming wand and then… well, we rewrote this comic three times, and still don’t feel all the way pleased with it. We don’t like doing comparisons and try to focus on toys’ unique properties, its ability to please somebody even if it’s not us. But with the Le Wands we just couldn’t get away from it, even their website combatively talks smack about the Magic Wand, so we HAVE to bring up the copy-catting.

Cloning successful toys isn’t anything new in the toy industry, it seems like everyone has their only subtly different approach to every money-maker. But usually companies innovate along the way, small subtle improvements that we can focus on and appreciate. This was one of the reasons I think Doxy stands out compared with Le Wand. The Doxy team brought new things to their wand-game, their toy feels and looks different. It’s a different flavor on one of our favorite meals. Le Wand is the same meal, just sold at a different restaurant and at a higher price.

We don’t think you should shy away from these toys. Heck, my meal analogy still works here – it’s a damn fine lunch, one we really do recommend. It’s just that if you’ve got a choice on where to eat it…

Bummers aside, we DO enjoy the heck out of the Petite – if only that price tag was a little lower I think it could be a must-buy. I love that it’s USB chargeable, has a fancy travel lock and still packs a punch. Sort of feels like a toy to pack for a long trip…

If you are interested in our other Wand reviews, (in chronological order) take a peek here:
Our first review comic – the Magic Wand Original!
Doxy
Magic Wand Rechargeable
Doxy Die Cast
Doxy number 3
Magic Wand Plus

Take a look at the Le Wand yourself and don’t be afraid to pick one up if it catches your eye!

item.title: Captain Dildo
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: The Captain and the (slightly thinner) First Mate have been a staple of a lot of our go-to indie stores, so we thought it was about time we got our feet wet and tried one of them out. We had fun with this semi-anatomical dildo. It’s got a generous amount of girth, and serious firmness […]
item.content:encoded:
Captain Dildo

by Matthew Nolan on 11/19/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Dildos »
  • Review Comics

The Captain and the (slightly thinner) First Mate have been a staple of a lot of our go-to indie stores, so we thought it was about time we got our feet wet and tried one of them out.

We had fun with this semi-anatomical dildo. It’s got a generous amount of girth, and serious firmness – a combination that sort of feels mean but also very satisfying. It made itself feel very present, both in the hand and in the bod. Definitely not a beginner-friendly toy, but perfect for the intermediate who wants to feel very, very full. All in all, super fun!

While I was putting the buy buttons together, I discovered that PleasureChest stocks a DUAL density model. It’s the same dildo, but with a softer outside and hard inside (instead of the one-density, solid version we have) at a slightly higher price. I’d have picked that one in a heartbeat if I’d know – dual-density dildos are the bee’s knees. So maybe take a peek at that if you’ve got a little more cash to spend. If you’re looking to save though, Early to Bed has the captain priced at $50 which is a real meal deal for such a unit.

Buy it from one of our Friends (With Benefits)

item.title: Sex and Breastfeeding by Boum
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Boum’s BACK and talking all about breastfeeding and sex. If you remember, she was here only a few months ago talking about Pregnancy Sex. I was a bit sad to hear recently that she plans on stopping her long time running auto bio comic, so that she could spend more time with the kids and […]
item.content:encoded:
Sex and Breastfeeding by Boum

by Matthew Nolan on 11/12/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Favorites »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Health

Boum’s BACK and talking all about breastfeeding and sex. If you remember, she was here only a few months ago talking about Pregnancy Sex.

I was a bit sad to hear recently that she plans on stopping her long time running auto bio comic, so that she could spend more time with the kids and try new comics. But I’m ALSO excited to see what she does next – Boum’s just a powerhouse of a comics creator and I’m sure whatever she’ll move onto will blow all our socks off. It’s also kind of a good thing for us readers? I think it can be really satisfying reading a whole and finished comic series, having the knowledge that it’s finite.

  • Portfolio
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Boumeries (Webcomic)
  • Instagram
  • Patreon

If you remember rightly, last week I talked about how today’s comic would be all about Chastity Devices. WELP. We decided to put a big ol’ pause on it after running into some unusual issues. We’ll pick it back up in the future I’m sure, and Erika will be writing a bunch more about it on her Patreon, maybe even sharing a sneak peak of the version we’ll ultimately rework.

└ Tags: baby, boob, Boum, breast, breast feeding, Breastfeeding, education, guest, guest comic, kids, pregnancy

Here are a few links to get you started: Resources ► Miscarriage on Planned Parenthood ► Miscarriage: What It Is, Why It Happens and How to Deal on Scarleteen ► Miscarriage Association Support ► All-Options Talkline ► Miscarriage Support on […]
item.content:encoded:
Miscarriage

by Erika Moen on 10/22/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health

As always, please use our comic as a starting point on your own research dive. Here are a few links to get you started:

Resources


► Miscarriage on Planned Parenthood
► Miscarriage: What It Is, Why It Happens and How to Deal on Scarleteen
► Miscarriage Association

Support


► All-Options Talkline
► Miscarriage Support on Tommy’s
► The Best Advice I Received After My Miscarriage on Good House Keeping
► After a Miscarriage: Surviving Emotionally on American Pregnancy
► How To Support Someone Going Through Pregnancy Loss on Huffington Post

Our previous comics on reproduction can be found here: Pregnancy, Pregnancy Sex by Boum, In-Clinic Abortion, Medical Abortion, and our comics on contraception can be found here: Emergency Contraception, The Pill, Paragard IUD, Condom Basics, Internal Condom, Other Contraceptive Methods

On a personal note, here’s the conversation Matt and I had when my period was a week late.

I ran into some of AyCee’s comic work a few years ago and instantly fell in love. They have such a lovely style and their characters feel rich and fun. Not safe for work Table for Three and Safeword are especially fantastic.

We’re lucky enough to have AyCee here on OJST with this amazing comic about their story of a freeing Bilateral Salpingectomy (Rosalarian has covered this surgery for us before! So give that a look if you’re looking for more on the subject). I think it’s just an awesome piece – thank you AyCee!

If you’re also smitten, take a peek at their work with the links below. Drop them a sale or Patreon pledge while you’re at it too! Hopefully, it’ll entice them to come back and make us another comic or two ;D

Alex is pretty much a staple here and has covered a ton of things for us over the years. Puppy Play, Satisfyer Pro, Tokidoki, and the larger Buck Off.

If you don’t already follow him- I’d 100% recommend you do. He puts out so much positivity into the world, and seeing his tweets pop up into my timeline are always a feel-good moment. Go tell him he’s awesome!

item.title: Magic Wand Plus & Mental Health
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: Dang. What do I even say here? I’ll start with some links, howaboutthat. That very first Magic Wand was sent to me as an exchange with Searah from Early to Bed back about a decade or so ago, long, looooong before OJST was a twinkle in Matt’s and my eye. Fast-forward to 2013, when we […]
item.content:encoded:
Magic Wand Plus & Mental Health

by Erika Moen on 09/24/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Favorites »
  • Review Comics »
  • Vibrators

Dang. What do I even say here?

I’ll start with some links, howaboutthat.

That very first Magic Wand was sent to me as an exchange with Searah from Early to Bed back about a decade or so ago, long, looooong before OJST was a twinkle in Matt’s and my eye. Fast-forward to 2013, when we released our very first review with that same Magic Wand. Then, several years later, Magic Wand released the Rechargeable, and would even later become Sponsors of OJST, three years running! It’s such a wonderful fit, getting to work with a company that, obviously, we’re both long-time fans of.

Ok, as for mental health stuff… I’ve been posting sporadically about my experiences on Instagram and Twitter when the mood strikes, and posting autobio comics about it on Patreon. I finished up the Intensive Outpatient Program in August and I’ll be starting a longer term Dialectical Behavior Therapy program through the hospital in October that’ll last about six months.

I know I’m supposed to say something, like, encouraging here. You know. “If you’re struggling… reach out! Get help!” or “It’ll get better!” or something. I’m not really feeling that right now, though? I mean, I’m not feeling the opposite of that either. I’m just… here. I’m here. I’m putting in the time and I’m doing the work and I’m tired. It’s hard. If you’re struggling with your mental health, jesus, you have all my empathy and I hope you can get the help that you need. Because getting that outside, structured help from people who really do understand what you’re dealing with really can make all the difference. For Americans, the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration has a hotline to call and for you international folks, google a combination of “mental health resources” and the name of your area. I dunno. There is no “cure” but there can be a reduction in suffering (Or, at least, that’s what I’m told). Take care of yourself. Do what you need to survive and find the assistance you need. Good luck.

item.title: Sexual Dysfunction
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Ok, so today’s comic is a smidge light – I know many of you will be shouting out ‘go deeper- explore the specific disorder I wanna learn about!’ We’ll for sure eventually get to the specific ones and explore them more thoroughly. We might have explored a few already in the health category. Thing is, […]
item.content:encoded:
Sexual Dysfunction

by Matthew Nolan on 09/17/2019 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health

Ok, so today’s comic is a smidge light – I know many of you will be shouting out ‘go deeper- explore the specific disorder I wanna learn about!’ We’ll for sure eventually get to the specific ones and explore them more thoroughly. We might have explored a few already in the health category. Thing is, for the next Drawn to Sex book, we needed a solid catch-all comic, something that introduces the subject and explains how anyone experiencing it is normal – it happens to us all. So that’s what we have today – a light comic that skims the surface!

If you’re feeling represented in this comic and see your own woes appearing, I’d really encourage you to go and have a frank conversation with your doctor. A good doc will listen and help and, honestly, they’ve heard it all before. You’ve nothing to be embarrassed or afraid of.

Next week, a review! First one in an age – we’re excited, it’s going to be half review and half autobio catchup.

└ Tags: arousal disorder, desire disorder, disorder, education, erectile dysfunction, orgasm disorder, pain disorder, Sexual Dysfunction, sexual response cycle

If you want to find more from Italy’s DaZa, check out the following links! They’ve promised to draw more of these two on their patreon, so it might be worth a watch =D

Next week Erika and I are hoping to get you all a comic on Sexual Dysfunction 0_0 a doozy of a subject, so wish us luck!

Also if you didn’t see or hear – our new year of Sponsorship JUST STARTED. We’re so darn happy about getting last years sponsors to sign up again. Let them know you approve =D
